sentence.content: Turbulence in the global diamond markets is being felt even here at Venetia, De Beers&apost; newest diamond mine, 30km from South Africa&apost;s borders with Botswana and Zimbabwe.

sentence.content: Only weeks before the mine came into production in July 1992 at a cost of USDollars 400m, De Beers&apost; Central Selling Organisation, which controls 80 per cent of world trade in rough (uncut) diamonds, imposed quotas on its producer-suppliers because of a flood of gem stones from Angola.

sentence.content: And, while Venetia is using conventional methods to mine about 500m tonnes of waste and to mine and process 100m tonnes of ore over its projected 23-year life, it is trying some highly innovative ideas about labour relations and environmental issues, at least as far as South Africa is concerned.

sentence.content: Venetia is also breaking with the De Beers&apost; tradition that, for security reasons, no equipment leaves the mine but is burried within the top security area once it is no longer useful.
